description: I've faced with problem when service state of compute node got from nova-manage service list command was XXX most time and some times it was ok, despite in fact compute was ok all time. I found that it coused by time shift between controller and compute node. I think that is the bug to treat node as down basing only on update time, because if we try to ping, probe tcp port or any other real ways to conversate with node we will found it ok.
title: Weak service state probe algorithm

comments.content: I've faced with problem when service state of compute node got from nova-manage service list command was XXX most time and some times it was ok, despite in fact compute was ok all time. I think that is the bug to treat node as down basing only on update time, because if we try to ping, probe tcp port or any other real ways to conversate with node we will found it ok.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~usrleon

comments.content:
I think that this is design behavior. Nova controller need to check the status of nova-compute service on compute node but not the compute state.

If the compute is ok but the nova compute service was down on compute node, nova controller will think the compute is down and cannot be used for schedule.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jay-lau-513

comments.content: In my case it was just time shift approx. 60 sec. Compute service was available but any task (boot or delete vm) had been disapearing without any response. i.e. all vms that I tried to delete stuck in deleted=1 vm_state=active, they disapeared from "instance" tab but still showed in summary.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~usrleon

comments.content: Although the current design perhaps isn't the best we can do.  I think having synchronized clocks is a reasonable prerequisite to running nova.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: Yes, NTP is required for now.
